In Julia, Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

Here is the implementation of the `wrap_string` function in Julia:

```julia
function wrap_string(str::String, text_width::Int=10)
    words = split(str)
    current_line = ""
    result = String[]

    for word in words
        if length(current_line) + length(word) > text_width
            push!(result, current_line)
            current_line = word
        else
            if current_line != ""
                current_line *= " "
            end
            current_line *= word
        end
    end
    push!(result, current_line)  # append last line

    return join(result, '\n')
end
```

This function takes as input a string `str` and an integer `text_width` which represents the maximum number of characters allowed in each line. If adding a new word to the current line would exceed this threshold, then the current line is saved in the result array as a separate line, and the new word becomes the start of a new line.

Here is an example:

```julia
str = "Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Integer nec odio."
println(wrap_string(str))
```

This will print:

```
Lorem ipsum
dolor sit
amet,
consectetur
adipiscing
elit.
Integer nec
odio.
```
